item.title: BI deports 75 Chinese arrested over illegal online gaming ops
item.description: The Philippines has deported 75 Chinese nationals who were arrested last year over what authorities say are illegal online gaming operations in Quezon City.

item.title: DepEd gives go signal to use 17,000 classrooms in NCR as isolation, quarantine facilities
item.description: The Department of Education (DepEd) on Thursday confirmed that it is allowing the use of 50 percent of the government-run classrooms in Metro Manila as isolation and quarantine facilities.

item.title: NCR transpo sectors ready to resume operations once restrictions ease
item.description: Authorities on Thursday assured lawmakers that the various modes of public transportation in Metro Manila are ready to go back to operations once quarantine restrictions ease in the metropolis.

item.title: DepEd chief Briones on Aug. 24 opening of classes: 'Tuloy na tuloy talaga'
item.description: "Tuloy pa rin. Tuloy na tuloy talaga on August 24 ang opening of classes," Education Secretary Leonor Briones said in a Palace briefing.

item.title: Medicine China claims it uses as cure for COVID-19 reaches Manila
item.description: A woman in Manila on Thursday, August 13, 2020 shows stock of traditional medicine supposedly used in China as COVID-19 treatment called "Lianhua Qingwen."

item.title: B. Braun Avitum vows cooperation with gov't after being linked to PhilHealth's IRM releases
item.description: "We are one with the government in its quest for transparency and good governance, and will extend full cooperation in this endeavor," B. Braun Avitum said in a press statement.

item.title: 600 LSIs staying in temporary shelters amid MECQ --Encabo
item.description: Around 600 locally stranded individuals (LSIs) are staying in temporary shelters amid the ban in public transportation under the modified enhanced community quarantine (MECQ) in Metro Manila and four nearby provinces.

item.title: NBI creates task force to investigate PhilHealth
item.description: The National Bureau of Investigation (NBI) has created a task force that will look into allegations of corruption in the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. (PhilHealth).

item.title: Hontiveros reminds gov't to be cautious amid 'COVID-19 vaccine race'
item.description: "Although we are looking forward to the development of a vaccine against COVID-19, kailangan nating maging maingat at siguraduhing ligtas ito at pumasa sa lahat ng strict medical trials," Senator Risa Hontiveros said on Twitter.

item.title: Duterte to be injected with Sputnik V as early as May 2021 --Palace
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte could be injected with Russia s COVID-19 vaccine as early as May 2021, MalacaÃ±ang said Thursday, despite growing skepticism about its safety and effectiveness.

item.title: More PUJs to be allowed once Metro Manila returns to GCQ, LTFRB vows
item.description: The Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board (LTFRB) on Thursday said more units of public utility jeepneys (PUJs) will be allowed to ply through Metro Manila roads once quarantine restrictions are eased, possibly by August 19.

item.title: Order preventive suspension of execs in PhilHealth mess, Roque urges TF
item.description: Presidential spokesperson Harry Roque on Thursday, in his own capacity, urged the task force probing the supposed anomalies in the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. (PhilHealth) to immediately order the preventive suspension of officials to ensure the integrity of the investigation.

item.title: DILG asks Congress to allot P5B from Bayanihan 2 fund for hiring of contact tracers
item.description: âWith a projected population of 108 million this year, we need 50,000 more contact tracers to attain the ideal number of 135,000 contact tracers to pursue quick and credible tracing of close contacts of confirmed COVID-19 patients,â Interior Secretary Eduardo AÃ±o said in a press statement.

item.title: Sputnik V availability in Philippines seen by April 2021
item.description: Russia's anti-COVID-19 vaccine Sputnik V could be available for commercial use in the Philippines by April 2021, a Philippine official who recently met with Russian authorities said Thursday.

item.title: Vietnamese cargo vessel runs aground off Antique --PCG
item.description: The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) on Thursday responded to a maritime incident involving a Vietnamese cargo vessel that ran aground off Nagubat Island and Liwagao Island in Antique.
